005.synopsis: Arron is a friendly, but tired servant to the druids in the grove. Unless the player is a druid, he would rather they don't linger, though he is sympathetic and will help them any way he can (by selling them supplies). He is happy to see a druid and to help them. He can be a little preachy.

002.synopsis: A very condescending and somewhat objectionable druid servant. He believes the tiefling refugees hiding in the grove have brought chaos and would gladly be rid of them, even if turning them away would doom them.

003.synopsis: An elderly druid who would like nothing more than for the player to leave. Depending on what the player has done, he will be civil about it, but still incistent. If the child has died, he is openly hostile.

AD_ChaseAwayBoar.synopsis: |This AD plays when Tusk, a boar, interrupts a druid while she's participating in a long, intense ritual. Tusk is getting in the way.|

AD_Debate.synopsis:
Situation: M and L are discussing the state of the grove. Scenario 1) Child has died. A child has died at the hands of Sagha - the druid they support. L is shaken by the encounter and having doubts. M believes the punishment was just and is even inspired to do similar to the other tieflings in the grove.

2) Child escapes. M is frustrated that the child fled 'without punishment'. He believes the other tieflings will take this as a sign that they can be walked all over. L isn't so sure.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The sessions contain interactions with druids and the consequences of actions taken by the player. The 'AD_Debate' session depends on whether a child has died or escaped, which suggests a sequence. Specifically, if a child has died, it impacts the discussions between M and L regarding their beliefs about punishment and justice. Therefore, 'AD_Debate' can be seen as a successor to the events that led to the child's fate. Meanwhile, '005', '002', and '003' describe different druids' perspectives but do not have direct ordering relationships among them. However, they all occur in the same storyline context, which could mean they are conditionally exclusive based on player interactions. Since '005' and '002' are both servants to the druids, they likely cannot interact with the player in the same context if their situations clash, especially with differing attitudes towards the tieflings.

005_25.speaker: Arron
005_25.text: Another outsider? This place has certainly become popular.
005_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arron turns around and wipes his hands on his trousers (he was standing at a table, with his back to the player).

005_57.speaker: Arron
005_57.text: Well met, and thank you for beating back those goblins. Most brave of you.

005_49.speaker: Arron
005_49.text: Is there anything you need? I lower my prices for fellow druids.

005_24.speaker: Arron
005_24.text: But you'll need to be quick - the ritual will be complete before too long.

005_55.speaker: Arron
005_55.text: Is there anything you need? Act fast if you do - the ritual will be complete before too long.

005_58.speaker: Player
005_58.text: What ritual are you talking about?

005_39.speaker: Arron
005_39.text: Ah - I forgot you're a blow-in. A few days hence, this grove will be completely concealed by thorny vines.

005_38.speaker: Arron
005_38.text: None will be able to enter - or leave.

005_32.speaker: Arron
005_32.text: A drastic measure. But more monsters seem to terrorise this region every day.

005_14.speaker: Arron
005_14.text: We druids will be safe. As for those that took refuge here... well, may Silvanus guard them as they continue their travels.

005_47.speaker: Player
005_47.text: You just said the region's overrun by monsters. They won't survive by themselves.

005_31.speaker: Arron
005_31.text: As I said, it's a drastic measure. But the survival of the grove is paramount.

005_13.speaker: Arron
005_13.text: There just aren't enough supplies to support everyone.

005_42.speaker: Player
005_42.text: Dire times. High stakes. I understand.

005_34.speaker: Arron
005_34.text: You sound just like Kagha. Oh, that it had to come to this...

005_17.speaker: Arron
005_17.text: I pray to Silvanus each night - the Wild Father will protect those refugees. I hope.

005_21.speaker: Player
005_21.text: Seems like most are tieflings. They'll be fine. They have devilish powers.

005_0.speaker: Arron
005_0.text: Ignorance is agony, my friend. I will include you in my prayers. I'd better get started - for your sake.

005_56.speaker: Arron
005_56.text: I don't want this to happen either, but Kagha makes the decisions.

005_33.speaker: Arron
005_33.text: I can do nothing but pray to Silvanus in the hopes that He'll protect them.

005_22.speaker: Player
005_22.text: Your prayers won't save them. But your voice might sway Kagha.

005_8.speaker: Arron
005_8.text: You don't know Kagha. She won't listen. I'm truly sorry.

005_43.speaker: Player
005_43.text: Are you really locking down the grove?

005_11.speaker: Arron
005_11.text: I know it's drastic, but more monsters seem to terrorise this region every day.

005_12.speaker: Player
005_12.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: add tag to check if halsin isn't back yet

005_35.speaker: Arron
005_35.text: I pray no goblin arrow has grazed you!

005_27.speaker: Arron
005_27.text: Nettie could put you to rights. She should be with the others in the inner chambers, but I doubt she'll be taking on new patients. The grove will be locked down soon.

005_23.speaker: Player
005_23.text: So you're really locking down the grove?

005_4.speaker: Arron
005_4.text: Nettie's your best bet, with Master Halsin gone. She should be with the others in the inner chambers.

005_51.speaker: Arron
005_51.text: Just some bits and bobs I no longer need.

005_44.speaker: Arron
005_44.text: Refugees, adventurers - no one in years and suddenly we're overwhelmed.
005_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arron turns around and wipes his hands on his trousers (he was standing at a table, with his back to the player).

005_36.speaker: Player
005_36.text: I'd like to see your wares.

005_19.speaker: Arron
005_19.text: Always happy to help those who follow the First Circle.

005_20.speaker: Arron
005_20.text: Of course. But please remember: you're not the only one in need.

002_0.speaker: Marcoryl
002_0.text: You may have won over Kagha, but I'm not so easily swayed.

002_1.speaker: Marcoryl
002_1.text: Leave me. I detest the smell of sulphur.

002_2.speaker: Marcoryl
002_2.text: Goblin attacks and now a dead child. We never should have opened our gates.

002_3.speaker: Marcoryl
002_3.text: That poor child. This should never have happened. You people should have left when Kagha asked.

002_4.speaker: Marcoryl
002_4.text: By Silvanus - another outsider. Should you have an ounce of sense, you will leave. Immediately.

002_5.speaker: Marcoryl
002_5.text: You may be in Halsin's good graces, but mine are another matter. This grove is a darker place for your presence.

002_6.speaker: Marcoryl
002_6.text: No doubt the tieflings will blame us for the child's death. This is a disaster.

002_7.speaker: Marcoryl
002_7.text: What will the tieflings want next? Letting the hell child go was a mistake.

002_8.speaker: Marcoryl
002_8.text: It's outsiders like you who brought trouble in the first place. Away - I detest the sight of you.

002_9.speaker: Marcoryl
002_9.text: Remember - this is our grove. You are never far from watching eyes.

002_10.speaker: Marcoryl
002_10.text: Do not expect thanks for killing goblins. For all I know, you had something to do with Halsin's disappearance.

002_11.speaker: Marcoryl
002_11.text: Be gone - surely you have others to bother.

002_12.speaker: Marcoryl
002_12.text: What will you people want next? Letting the hell child go was a mistake.

003_0.speaker: Loic
003_0.text: Shadow Druids... To think we were rotting from within. I'm sorry. I need a moment.
003_0.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: Add Shadow Druid Flag. Reaction for after the player exposed the Shadow druid plot. I don't know if he'll be part of the druids who fight alongside Sagha (I don't know if all pro-sagha druids do). But this works both if Sagha got convinced and if she's dead.NodeContext: They just discovered that their boss was being influenced by an evil organisation.

003_1.speaker: Loic
003_1.text: Begone. You'll only help this grove by leaving it to us.

003_2.speaker: Loic
003_2.text: Shadow Druids... To think we were rotting from within. I'm sorry. I need a moment.
003_2.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: Add Shadow Druid Flag. Reaction for after the player exposed the Shadow druid plot. I don't know if he'll be part of the druids who fight alongside Sagha (I don't know if all pro-sagha druids do). But this works both if Sagha got convinced and if she's dead.NodeContext: They just discovered that their boss was being influenced by an evil organisation.

003_3.speaker: Loic
003_3.text: Please leave. Our hospitality has limits - and they were crossed long ago.

003_4.speaker: Loic
003_4.text: We never meant to hurt a child... you should leave. This grove has been disrupted enough.
003_4.context: NodeContext: He's coming to terms with what happened (a snake killed a child).

003_5.speaker: Loic
003_5.text: It all makes sense now. What Kagha did... the Shadow Druids poisoned her mind.
003_5.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: Add Shadow Druid Flag. Reaction for after the player exposed the Shadow druid plot. I don't know if he'll be part of the druids who fight alongside Sagha (I don't know if all pro-sagha druids do). But this works both if Sagha got convinced and if she's dead.NodeContext: They just discovered that their boss was being influenced by an evil organisation.

003_6.speaker: Loic
003_6.text: It all makes sense now. What Kagha did... the Shadow Druids poisoned her mind.
003_6.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: Add Shadow Druid Flag. Reaction for after the player exposed the Shadow druid plot. I don't know if he'll be part of the druids who fight alongside Sagha (I don't know if all pro-sagha druids do). But this works both if Sagha got convinced and if she's dead.NodeContext: They just discovered that their boss was being influenced by an evil organisation.

003_7.speaker: Loic
003_7.text: I asked you to leave. Staying will only disrupt the balance of this grove.

AD_ChaseAwayBoar_0.speaker: Apikusis
AD_ChaseAwayBoar_0.context: NodeContext: She's trying to be kind, but she's annoyed

AD_ChaseAwayBoar_1.speaker: Apikusis
AD_ChaseAwayBoar_1.text: Please, Tusk. It's not the time.

AD_ChaseAwayBoar_2.speaker: Apikusis
AD_ChaseAwayBoar_2.text: What did I tell you? Shoo!

AD_Debate_10.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_10.text: Oh? Because things went so well with Kagha?

AD_Debate_47.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_47.text: If it had been up to Kagha, they would never have been here at all.

AD_Debate_14.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_14.text: I'm no fan of those devils either, but they're leaving.

AD_Debate_12.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_12.text: Stopping the ritual was the right thing to do.

AD_Debate_35.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_35.text: But to not even consult with us?

AD_Debate_24.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_24.text: Are you the one doubting her now?

AD_Debate_54.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_54.text: O-of course not! But this was our best defence!

AD_Debate_17.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_17.text: Master Halsin's past his prime. It might be time for another.

AD_Debate_19.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_19.text: This isn't why I became a druid.

AD_Debate_53.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_53.text: It's not that. I just wish there was another way.

AD_Debate_1.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_1.text: Never took you for a coward.

AD_Debate_21.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_21.text: If only we'd never let the tieflings in... the child might have lived.

AD_Debate_39.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_39.text: You have master Halsin to blame for that.
AD_Debate_39.context: NodeContext: incredulous, repeating other actor's phrase back to him

AD_Debate_9.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_9.text: I can't believe he just left...

AD_Debate_22.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_22.text: He lost sight of what is important.

AD_Debate_25.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_25.text: We might as well lay down and let the goblins cut us up.

AD_Debate_38.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_38.text: They'll have to cut through all those tieflings first.

AD_Debate_33.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_33.text: Like that'll do any good! That ritual was our salvation.

AD_Debate_11.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_11.text: It was steeped in shadow magic!

AD_Debate_27.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_27.text: I still can't believe Master Halsin is dead.

AD_Debate_58.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_58.text: I can. He let in outsiders, then rushed off - he's made one mistake after the other.

AD_Debate_8.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_8.text: What will we do without a First Druid?

AD_Debate_7.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_7.text: Exactly as we have always done - tend this grove. Nothing has changed.

AD_Debate_30.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_30.text: This will all be over. The ritual's almost finished.

AD_Debate_16.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_16.text: What if they try to steal from us? Again?

AD_Debate_55.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_55.text: We've shown them once - we take grove law seriously.

AD_Debate_5.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_5.text: By letting that child escape without consequence?

AD_Debate_51.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_51.text: We might as well have lain on the ground and let them trample us.

AD_Debate_36.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_36.text: The ritual was flawed. It could've damaged the grove.

AD_Debate_49.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_49.text: And if the goblins get in here?

AD_Debate_32.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_32.text: What will happen to the grove? To us?

AD_Debate_20.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_20.text: We'll find another way to stop them. We must.

AD_Debate_37.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_37.text: Master Halsin's home - by Silvanus' mercy.

AD_Debate_46.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_46.text: It might've been better if he stayed away.

AD_Debate_56.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_56.text: Come now. He took IN those strays, and then he just left!

AD_Debate_0.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_0.text: He went to make sure those 'strays' could go.

AD_Debate_44.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_44.text: Ridiculous. We just let her run off?

AD_Debate_34.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_34.context: NodeContext: incredulous, repeating other actor's phrase back to him

AD_Debate_60.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_60.text: A devil child. One who tried to steal from us.

AD_Debate_28.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_28.text: Yet she failed - that's what matters.

AD_Debate_50.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_50.text: I pray the tieflings realise we are not to be trifled with.

AD_Debate_48.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_48.text: I just hope they leave, and we can close this grove in peace.

AD_Debate_40.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_40.text: And if it comes to a fight? You'll not shy away from bloodshed I hope.

AD_Debate_31.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_31.text: Since when did we become killers?

AD_Debate_52.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_52.text: Master Halsin was a First Druid. None of us can match him in power.

AD_Debate_18.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_18.text: The grove suffered because of Halsin. We have no need of him. Not anymore.

AD_Debate_57.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_57.text: I don't want blood on my hands.

AD_Debate_29.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_29.text: We have the right to defend our home.

AD_Debate_2.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate_2.text: So that's what you want? To kill a bunch of innocents?

AD_Debate_41.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate_41.text: I don't want to kill anyone - but I won't let this grove be harmed. Not again.
